title: GG ez at the end of a 55 minute game feels like shit.
body:
This is reportable right? I mean it just feels like shit, was a fantastic game up until that point.

For reference I don't believe I've ever said GG ez to the enemy team because I'm not a shit human being.

^ This. Saying GG EZ at the end of a game is essentially spitting in your opponents face. Imagine if Olympic athletes did that, they'd get benched if not removed from competing forever. It's not cool what so ever.
GG EZ does not equate to spitting in someones face regardless. Explain to me how says "gg ez" makes a "fantastic" game go to "horrible" game.

Imagine you've just won against someone in a game, not necessarily League. Could be baseball, chess, MMA, a race, whatever. Rather than, for instance, shaking their hand and acknowledging the effort both sides put into the match, you instead opt to belittle your opponent. It's not "just trash-talk," and you're not "trying to gain a mental advantage." The match is over. You're just being a dick.

That's what "gg ez" is.

belittle is to make someone feel irrelevant. How is that the same as trash talk?  trash talk is boastful commentary made to intimidate an opponent. belittling is NOT what "gg ez" is. even worse, when a 55 minute game ends with "gg ez" do you not think its sarcasm? also, is "gg ez" in anyway directly towards a certain person. NO. You don't know what trash talk is.

Given how often it is said in an negative and belittling  manner the likelihood that this is an exception where it is meant as a halfhearted joke is minimal; If that was the case the delivery was lackluster at best and it fell crudely on the audience and left a sour note on the experience.  I'll not deny that it can be said in jest but perhaps it is wiser to save that for more familiar company with whom you can more accurately measure the needed tact. 

Alot of the more aggressive trash talk is insulting and belittling  but not all of it, trashtalk is very broad but mainly falls into two categories boastful and belittling but certainly both are trash talk; Perhaps it would  be better if in the case of the latter that were not so but it is.

the minute i see GG EZ i know who i am reporting post game so if people want to risk their account they can keep doing it.

Wow, well I didn't expect to see people defending toxicity in here. Albeit minor amounts of it; the issue here is that "ggez" or any form thereof is unsportsmanlike conduct in any situation online or IRL as there is no interpretation of the comment that casts either party in a good light. As for how people should have thicker skin? Yeah, maybe so but that doesn't change the fact that it is not correct behavior. The "it doesn't bother me so its fine." mentality is exceedingly selfish in a community as other people may not. Perhaps they are dealing with IRL issues ( deaths, debt, ect.) and are playing LOL with some friends to de-stress or any number of other reasonable situations a person may not be in top form to muster their thick skin. Now  certainly there are people out there that are entirely to fragile and they will need to learn to deal with that before life kicks them in the arse but this effort to stamp out unsportsmanlike conduct in our community is not catering to the whines of fragile souls but a stern retort to the arrogant and toxic. 

Kinda like when you have a dumb pet that messes up the furniture and you spray it with water from a water bottle.

The reason many of you sit in Low Elos is because you are oversensitive. 
Another reason why our generation is called: Snowflake Generation.

Before you start attacking me, hear me out. 

In higher elo, everyone is mean. Everyone loses their shit, but this is what stress in a competitive atmosphere. 
The real world is no different. If everytime you cried because you had a busy week and your boss was upset with your performance, then you wouldn't do well at your work. 

Stress is expected and people get stressed. 
"**GG EZ**" is just a combination of letters that YOU gave meaning to. You gave it value and you chose to feel because of it. 
Ignore it and move on. Life doesn't backtrack, it keeps moving forward. 

So should you.

Good Luck everyone on your climb.

You don't have to take offense to know something is offensive.  Sensitivity doesn't come into it.  We Snowflakes just see no reason to tolerate pointless disrespect like "GG EZ" because it lessens the competitive experience for everybody.

I just got back from Pokémon Regional Championship in Collinsville Ill. I played the TCG (Trading card game).

All matches are a best of 3, last about 50 minuites total. At the end of every single match, we shake hands and say good game. I wish League was similar. Damn internet.
It's usually just the butthurt person that went 4/12 and got carried by their team that puts that. Ignore it and/or report it and move on.

Yeah, it’s unsportsmanlike.  Imagine saying that with a straight and serious face to the other team after a traditional sports match.  Everyone would think you were a jerk, and there could be consequences like getting benched, banned, or just left out.

Example of you being trash:

It does, but it also gets punished. There are lines that shouldn't be crossed.

Talking smack about a specific play qualifies as fine, but cross the line into demeaning the person themselves and you get the boot.

Sure didn’t happen when I played sports, though not organized basketball or tackle football.  In pick up games, everyone just had fun and cracked jokes.  In organized play, the only thing we ever said to the other team was “Good game” at the end.

I don’t know where this idea of trash talk being part of any sport comes from, especially if it’s as mean-spirited as “GG EZ” after a long game.
Bro where I played bball, trash talk was only second in importance to how well you could play.
I doubt the point was to actually hurt people’s feelings, though.  The whole point of saying GGEZ is to make the other person feel like their performance was worthless.  That’s just mean.

I believe getting killed over and over and losing the game makes you feel like crap more than some random on the internet saying ggez. lol Should we put like a 2 kill limit in lane to keep people from feeling like crap?

I played soccer and there was a lot of trash talk. From calling out who you were marking before kick off. "Hey I got this Harry Potter looking MFer" lol or if it was to get in their head when they had the ball. "stop going right... your garbage... do you have a left foot?... You will never get by me" It's to get in peoples head to make them lose focus on the team game. Make them be more concerned with over coming you and not the actual game.

I don't know if my point matters. But I have seen great players fail to lesser players because they let the opponent get in their head. A big part of sports\games is psychological. 

I guess ggez is after the game is over tho. So I guess it just depends if you are mature enough to handle some random person on the internet saying mean things at that point.
